name: places/ChIJzSQ9-htawokRBI1wiMijVB8
formattedAddress: 125 Barclay St, New York, NY 10007, USA
adrFormatAddress: 125 Barclay St, New York, NY 10007, USA

originalText.text: The people who work the phones here are rude and dumb. They can’t answer a basic question, get irrationally angry if you don’t read their minds, and every single person I’ve ever spoken to has a really nasty attitude. They also can’t do basic logic or think through a simple problem. I am concerned that there is a mold infestation in the building making all the phone operators stupider, because that’s the only reasonable explanation I can think of.

originalText.text:
I worked under this union for two years and I must say there is no greater scam in the world. This union will deduct and deduct from your checks - they'll even send a representative to you nonstop until you sign up for their union but as soon as you do sign up, they disappear. When you call any office for help with any issue, no one is ever available to help or provide any guidance, they refer you to someone else each time. It's impossible to get an answer for anything. I feel sorry for all the employees still working under this scum union I really wish I had the energy for a lawsuit against them.

College reimbursement? No answer.
Union representative no answer.
Main office? Lazy worker that just sends you elsewhere. The low effort and zero help is what ticked me off the most about this union.

Their shady practices are evident in the way they answer you and refuse to give any help of the sort. I spent months and months trying to reach my union representative until one day I got fed up and emailed everyone in their directory. The supervisor said wow, you really did that? Well... It got me an answer didn't it? I could only get a refund for a few months but it wasn't satisfactory for the misery they paid and the high fees they take. I would recommend to everyone to leave this union and keep their money. This is run by shady people with self interest.

Many times you'll be told that your union representative is on vacation! Everyone gets told the same thing. Do your self a favor and reach out to get your union fees back because you can! Get a notarized letter stating that you want reimbursement and to opt out of this corrupt union.

As you read through the comments on this page you will see that what I speak of is a shared experience by many hard working professionals, not just a single individual case. These notes are the stories of hard working new Yorkers who are turned down  and scammed by their own union, listen to their stories! If anyone is interested in starting a lawsuit of some sort let me know, I'm sure they've robbed us all.

originalText.text: Please do not trust the Personal Service Unit, under the direction of Stephanie Klinberg and Rachel Edricks, with your health care needs. They have very low expectations about the skillfulness and competency of their staff, as evidenced by the quality of service, and are not involved in ensuring their staff is communicating honestly with clients and making ethical decisions about care. From my experience, Alex Fedurina was not interested in providing a helpful service and instead prioritized using the time as a learning experience for herself. I found her style flat, detached, and without expressions of concern or interest in well-being. I found her clinical and professional judgement poor; she is not 100% honest/transparent about her capabilities or aware of how to assess client progress. She can offer some insights about workplace concerns. She intellectualizes and is long winded about concepts without addressing the emotional aspect of you as a person or affirming your value and human worth. I do not recommend this service provider.

originalText.text: Would give a negative star if it were possible. These people are criminals. The antics that have gone on through this union over the past few months is dehumanizing. Nothing gets done, calls don’t get answered. Union president doesn’t show up to meetings, return calls or emails. The union members are unhappy unpaid and unattended to. Do not ever work for this union unless you enjoy stress and working for free while paying dues.

originalText.text: I've been dealing with these ppl for years. I pay union dues. I have a new representative Kevin McLaurin & I am so appalled. He kept interrupting me when I was speaking. Then accused me of yelling and raising my voice. I'm already frustrated looking for help. That was no help. I had to contact her supervisor.
